result.execSummary:
The defendant Darin R Bolander Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Darin R Bolander in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole Williams Buttery for Tedia K. Gamino.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #1, repeater struck.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1, repeater struck.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Williams Buttery makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
60 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS. Consecutive to any sentence. 
Term of Probation: 1 Year
Court will consider early release upon full payment of restitution.  
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Restitution: $200.00 to be paid to M.C. as a condition of probation. 
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury status hearing at 02-11-2016 10:30 am
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-16-2016 08:30 am
New Lisbon Correctional Institution

Defendant Darin R Bolander appeared by video conference from New Lisbon CI, in custody.  Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery appeared by phone. .   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court to do an order to produce from New Lisbon Correctional Institution.  Court sets this case for trial.  Court will conduct voir dire.  Parties to file any questions by the jury status hearing.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for February 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.
